intro: Ayenia sambiranensis, commonly known as the Sambiranensis Ayenia, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
